alert.note: Alert for Estancia Valley; Santa Fe Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 13 at 8:19PM MST until November 14 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...QUICK BURST OF WINTER WEATHER TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... .A quick-hitting winter storm system will produce a burst of snow and wind with much colder temperatures tonight through Monday morning. Travel impacts are possible over parts of the area with areas of snow, strong winds, blowing snow, and reduced visibility. Wind chill values Monday morning will fall into the single digits. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 8 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...Estancia Valley and Santa Fe Metro Area. * WHEN...From Midnight tonight to 8 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Plan on snow packed or icy road conditions. This includes portions of I-40 and U.S. 285 around Moriarty, Clines Corners and I-25 from Las Vegas to Santa Fe. The hazardous conditions will impact the Monday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Estancia Valley; Santa Fe Metro Area
